revised_title: Male Reproductive Organs in Cartilaginous Fishes
tldr: The author examines the male reproductive organs of cartilaginous fishes, specifically the testes, epididymides, and vas deferentia, using specimens of Torpedo oculata and Torpedo diversicolor. They observe the structure and function of these organs, and analyze the contents under a microscope, discovering various types of animalcules and globules in the fluids. The study provides insights into the reproductive system of these fish species.
